Text: Re Enron North America Corp NYMEX Hedge Exemption Applications Cc considering opening an account to trade commodities on my own What are the implications Thanks Yannis Tzamouranis Enron North America Corp From Mark Taylor ENRON PM Sent by Enron NRON To All Enron Houston EveryoneinECTCalgary EveryoneinECTLondon EveryoneinECTPortland EveryoneinECTNew York EveryoneinECTDenver EveryoneinECTOslo EveryoneinECTSingapore EIAustralia Buenos Aires Argentina Office Staff Buenos Aires Argentina TGS Office Staff Enron EveryoneEOGDenver Enron EveryoneEOGCalgary cc Subject Enron North America Corp NYMEX Hedge Exemption Applications We are in the process of preparing applications for position limit exemptio ns for ENAs NYMEX energy commodities futures trading These applications require that ENA represent whether its officers employees owners or agen ts have a power of attorney control or have a financial interest in any other related commodity futures account either individually or acting with another person pursuant to express or implied agreement Please direct any responses to my paralegal Tana Jones via intercompany email or call her at by the end of business Friday June if you have any power of attorney control or have a financial interes t in any commodity futures account other than an ENA or other trading affiliate account IF YOU DO NOT HAVE A COMMODITY FUTURES ACCOUNT YOU DO NOT NEED TO RESPOND TO THIS REQUEST

Re Enron North America Corp NYMEX Hedge Exemption Applicationsyou for the information Tana Yannis From Tana Jones on AM To Yannis CT cc Mark CT Ted CT Subject Re Enron North America Corp NYMEX Hedge Exemption Applications Yannis Thanks for your email Enron Company Policy prohibits employees from trading any products that the company trades Besides energy commodities natgas crude oil products power the company also trades interest rates currencies pulp paper weather plastics and metals I am sure this product base will expand in the future I am sure this product base will continue to expand If you have any questions about trading a particular product please call me at x I am a paralegal in the Legal Dept Mark Taylor VP General Counsel of Trading at x or Ted Murphy Control at x Yannis RE Prof Carmonamy apologies for the late response and thank you for your input Yannis Original Message From Kaminski Vince Sent Tuesday March PM To Yannis NRON Cc Kaminski Vince Mark NRON Shanbhogue Vasant Subject Prof Carmona Yannis I have looked at the outline of the proposed course and find that practically all the topics of the program are the staple of what we do every day I dont think Research should spend money for this class If we want to establish a relationship we can easily do it by asking him to work on a research project Vince

Re Spring workshop Cc It is my pleasure to announce the visit of professor Rene Carmona from Princeton on February This web site may provide a little information on professor Carmona rcarmona Professor Carmona is going to talk to us about his research endeavors in weather and financial engineering Similarly we will make a short presentation of our activities and research interests The aim of the meeting is to explore areas of common interest and investigate the possibility of collaborating in certain research areas The time is pm Room EBC is reserved for pm Please plan on attending Also do let me know if you would like to include someone else to this distribution list Yannis Tzamouranis

Re HDAF seminar topics Cc I have tentatively set the date for our first roundtable discussion for Wednesday December th at pmpm The room EB will be available from to pm If any of you have an issue with the date please let me know by days end Professor Don Kouri of the Physics Department of the University of Houston will start with an informal minute presentation see appended abstract below of his work and will then lead a discussion as well answer questions that we may have Professor Kouri please let me know if you have any requirements for audiovisual or other equipment This excerpt from a previous correspondence provides an insight to the subject of our meeting topics to be discussed at a small roundtable format meeting are HDAFs for data analysis including gapfilling data extrapolation denoising mathematical manipulations of digital data eg taking derivatives applying functions of differential operators to digital data etc HDAFs as the basis of numerical algorithms for solving nonlinear partial differential equations particularly for equations for which existing methods encounter stability problems There are certainly other areas of interest and applications of the HDAFs but I think that even trying to do both of the above in a single meeting would be difficult Of course in this first meeting we would focus on general aspects of the HDAFs that make them robust for such applications If however you have other topics in which you are interested I am willing to focus on them Yannis Tzamouranis Yannis Tzamouranis on PM To Mark CT Claudio nron Joseph CT Vince J CT Todd nron Vasant CT cc Subject HDAF seminar topics Folks I am trying to set up a meeting with professor Don Kouri of the University of Houston and I believe you may have an interest in the topic of discussion If you know of other interested parties or want to substitute a proxy for yourselves please let me know This first meeting with Dr Kouri will introduce the participants to his area of research HDAFs for data analysis and allow us to define the contents and attendants of a seminar to come up soon We are looking to hold this discussion this week hopefully and to have the seminar happen before Christmas given that this is the inbetween semester season for schools A couple of other similar meetings will follow up Dr Kevin Bassler will be talking about Microscopic Simulation of Economic Markets and Dr Pinsky about the Effect of Solar phenomena on the Earths atmosphere Yannis Forwarded by Yannis TzamouranisHOUECT on PM ittenchemuhedu PM To cc Subject HDAF seminar topics Hi Yannis I got your email without any problem Regarding timing of a meeting I am free from teaching duties now so I am flexible I will be in Houston all of December I look forward to hearing more from you With best wishes Don Kouri

HDAF seminar topicsI am trying to set up a meeting with professor Don Kouri of the University of Houston and I believe you may have an interest in the topic of discussion If you know of other interested parties or want to substitute a proxy for yourselves please let me know This first meeting with Dr Kouri will introduce the participants to his area of research HDAFs for data analysis and allow us to define the contents and attendants of a seminar to come up soon We are looking to hold this discussion this week hopefully and to have the seminar happen before Christmas given that this is the inbetween semester season for schools A couple of other similar meetings will follow up Dr Kevin Bassler will be talking about Microscopic Simulation of Economic Markets and Dr Pinsky about the Effect of Solar phenomena on the Earths atmosphere Yannis Forwarded by Yannis TzamouranisHOUECT on PM ittenchemuhedu PM To cc Subject HDAF seminar topics Hi Yannis I got your email without any problem For possible topics to be discussed at a small roundtable format meeting here are some possibilities HDAFs for data analysis including gapfilling data extrapolation denoising mathematical manipulations of digital data eg taking derivatives applying functions of differential operators to digital data etc HDAFs as the basis of numerical algorithms for solving nonlinear partial differential equations particularly for equations for which existing methods encounter stability problems There are certainly other areas of interest and applications of the HDAFs but I think that even trying to do both of the above in a single meeting would be difficult Of course in this first meeting we would focus on general aspects of the HDAFs that make them robust for such applications If however you have other topics in which you are interested I am willing to focus on them Regarding timing of a meeting I am free from teaching duties now so I am flexible I will be in Houston all of December I look forward to hearing more from you With best wishes Don Kouri

Compendium of Research issuesI thought you might be interested in this too We have had several meetings with UH up until now and things are progressing nicely Rice U will follow in mid January and after that Uof Co at Boulder and Chicago will follow too Per Mark Tawneys request I am going to include you in another message following this Don Kouri from UH will be visiting soon The purpose of that discussion will be his area of research more details in the next message on that and a seminar wed like to set up and include your folks too Yannis Forwarded by Yannis TzamouranisHOUECT on PM Yannis Tzamouranis PM To Mark CT Gary CT D Todd CT Yannis CT Steven CT Joseph CT Brando ct Michael CT Rajib CT Valter NRON Timothy M CT Todd nron Reno NRON Seth nron Brian NRON Salisha nron Betty J CT Gray nron cc Subject Compendium of Research issues Folks in view of our upcoming collaboration with educational research institutions I am putting together a compendium of problem statements within various research domains This list will be used to solicit the interest of researchers and graduate students who would then work under our supervision While the details of how this effort will be organized are still largely up in the air list of financial institutions reporting structure financial considerations confidentiality agreements exchange of seminars and short courses etc we are making an attempt to define our common interests Such areas are Econophysical eg market development how weather expectations shape the market etc Product development eg agriculture and weather solar radiation and telecommunications the Jet stream and Airlines etc AnalyticalMathematicalSimulation efforts building a MC simulation for any given problem might fall under here working with incomplete data sheetsways for filling in data holes etc Purely weather eg a statistical analysis of the long term effects of solar phenomena on weather would enter this category In light of the above and within the next couple of daysI would like to ask you to provide me with problem statements within these areas that you have an interest in and which might offer themselves to this kind of collaboration At this point were brainstorming we would thus be happy to have even the sketchiest of ideas and have the weakest of expectations for well formulated projects Looking forward to hearing from you Yannis T

Contacts at UH for Econophysics Cc are the contacts from UH I would recommend that for a first contact the following people be involved Larry Pinsky PhysicsChair Joe McCauley professor George Reiter professor Their coordinates and some schedules are below If Larry is out of town prof Gunaratne would be a good alternative Please let me know how I can help further Yannis Forwarded by Yannis TzamouranisHOUECT on PM Prof Lawrence Pinsky on AM To cc Subject Contacts at UH for Econophysics Yannis Let me give you the names and contact information regarding the appropriate personnel here to include in an initial discussion regarding the prospects for developing a program here in we have to find a better name econophysics For an initial meeting it is reasonable to include Professores McCauley and Reiter as well as myself if I am available If I am not available you should consider including Professor Gemunu Gunaratne our current Associate Chair and a theoreticial with an interest in this area in his own right Professor Joseph McCauley Phone Fax Email Professor George Reiter Phone Fax Email Professor Chair Lawrence Pinsky Phone Fax Email OR an alternate for me Associate Professor and Associate Chair Gemunu Gunaratne Phone Fax Email Also FYI one other new faculty member with a potential interest in this field is Assistant Professor effective Kevin Bassler Phone Fax Email General Administrative Contact Ms Jennifer ChinDavis Department Business Administrator Phone Fax Email FYI I will be in Houston May June If the meeting is held on another date please include Prof Gunaratne in my place Larry

Joe McCauleys papersas promised these are a couple of references that I have for Joe McCauleys papers econophysicscommentsnoviseconometricshtml econophysicscommentsnovpaperofthemonthdechtml Whether the specific papers are of interest to what exactly were doing or not I cannot say On the other hand given UHs drive to create an Econophysics specialization within the physics department I thought we could both help them and drive it towards a direction that it could be of use to us I think that they would very much like to hear what the Industry would like to see from such a specialization Some of the things that have been discussed as course offerings would be Basic physics courses mechanics nonlinear dynamics stat physicsmath methods various finance courses like options banking etc Statistics Math Methods and Statistical Physics that could teach topics like BRownian motion lognormal distributions fractals Levy flights and statistics of large deviations which are of interest Comp Science Java C data structures algorithms Monte Carlo simulations etc Setting up some sort of exchange where at minimum we could get summer interns from this program would also be beneficial to both sides Even better a wider collaboration between Enron and the Physics department could be set up After this message I will inform Joe McCauley and Larry Pinsky departmental chair person of your suggestions on how to proceed I will send Shirley their contact information to arrange for a visit at the beginning of June Thanks Yannis

Re the research lunch Cc be very willing to make a presentation to you This coming Thursday unfortunately I have a sick day scheduled babies will do this kind of thing to you and will not come into the office Would it be more practical to make the presentation to a select group of a few possibly interested individuals This might give us more shceduling flexibility and would also seem more appropriate knowing that what I have is a set of suggestions for development and no earthshuttering live product Please let me know if this accomodates your needs Yannis Joseph Hrgovcic AM To Yannis CT cc Subject Re the research lunch Yannis Shirley will know the room in which the lunch is scheduled Let her know what audiovisual materials youll need Keep in mind that the research group is now about people some of whom will be watching the presentation on video from Portland and from London The best platform would be to get a PCvideo or PCscreen linkup so that everyone including people watching remotely can see your computers monitor on a big screen The itinerary for the lunch is that we meet at and eat lunch and trade news for the first minutes and then at or at the latest we have a presentation We try to wrap up by so that what we discussed yesterday should make for a very good presentation in pretty much every way From my experience the audiovisual people need at least an hour advance warning to get the screens linked up Let me know if you need any help in getting you and Jenny the things you need Joe Forwarded by Joseph HrgovcicHOUECT on AM Vince J Kaminski AM To Yannis CT cc Vince J CT Joseph CT Shirley CT Subject Re Is this data of interest to any of you Yannis It makes a lot of sense to get this info Also You are welcome to make a presentation to the group this Thursday at lunch Please call Shirley Crenshaw X to coordinate and order sandwich you would like to have Vince Joe Can you please babysit this presentation make sure we have all the audiovisual equipment we need etc Vince Yannis Tzamouranis PM To Yannis CT cc bcc Vince J KaminskiHOUECT Subject Is this data of interest to any of you FYI The following file describes the contents of the Monthly Energy Review Application Current and Historical The data is available through a DoE site and we can get it for free and incorporate it in the LIM database if there is interest Review the attached file look for keywords of interest and let us know whether need dictates loading these datasets For the Market Analysis and Infomration Management Group Yannis C Tzamouranis ENRON IT

Compendium of Research issuesI thought you might be interested in this too We have had several meetings with UH up until now and things are progressing nicely Rice U will follow in mid January and after that Uof Co at Boulder and Chicago will follow too Per Mark Tawneys request I am going to include you in another message following this Don Kouri from UH will be visiting soon The purpose of that discussion will be his area of research more details in the next message on that and a seminar wed like to set up and include your folks too Yannis Forwarded by Yannis TzamouranisHOUECT on PM Yannis Tzamouranis PM To Mark CT Gary CT D Todd CT Yannis CT Steven CT Joseph CT Brando ct Michael CT Rajib CT Valter NRON Timothy M CT Todd nron Reno NRON Seth nron Brian NRON Salisha nron Betty J CT Gray nron cc Subject Compendium of Research issues Folks in view of our upcoming collaboration with educational research institutions I am putting together a compendium of problem statements within various research domains This list will be used to solicit the interest of researchers and graduate students who would then work under our supervision While the details of how this effort will be organized are still largely up in the air list of financial institutions reporting structure financial considerations confidentiality agreements exchange of seminars and short courses etc we are making an attempt to define our common interests Such areas are Econophysical eg market development how weather expectations shape the market etc Product development eg agriculture and weather solar radiation and telecommunications the Jet stream and Airlines etc AnalyticalMathematicalSimulation efforts building a MC simulation for any given problem might fall under here working with incomplete data sheetsways for filling in data holes etc Purely weather eg a statistical analysis of the long term effects of solar phenomena on weather would enter this category In light of the above and within the next couple of daysI would like to ask you to provide me with problem statements within these areas that you have an interest in and which might offer themselves to this kind of collaboration At this point were brainstorming we would thus be happy to have even the sketchiest of ideas and have the weakest of expectations for well formulated projects Looking forward to hearing from you Yannis T

HDAF seminar topicsI am trying to set up a meeting with professor Don Kouri of the University of Houston and I believe you may have an interest in the topic of discussion If you know of other interested parties or want to substitute a proxy for yourselves please let me know This first meeting with Dr Kouri will introduce the participants to his area of research HDAFs for data analysis and allow us to define the contents and attendants of a seminar to come up soon We are looking to hold this discussion this week hopefully and to have the seminar happen before Christmas given that this is the inbetween semester season for schools A couple of other similar meetings will follow up Dr Kevin Bassler will be talking about Microscopic Simulation of Economic Markets and Dr Pinsky about the Effect of Solar phenomena on the Earths atmosphere Yannis Forwarded by Yannis TzamouranisHOUECT on PM ittenchemuhedu PM To cc Subject HDAF seminar topics Hi Yannis I got your email without any problem For possible topics to be discussed at a small roundtable format meeting here are some possibilities HDAFs for data analysis including gapfilling data extrapolation denoising mathematical manipulations of digital data eg taking derivatives applying functions of differential operators to digital data etc HDAFs as the basis of numerical algorithms for solving nonlinear partial differential equations particularly for equations for which existing methods encounter stability problems There are certainly other areas of interest and applications of the HDAFs but I think that even trying to do both of the above in a single meeting would be difficult Of course in this first meeting we would focus on general aspects of the HDAFs that make them robust for such applications If however you have other topics in which you are interested I am willing to focus on them Regarding timing of a meeting I am free from teaching duties now so I am flexible I will be in Houston all of December I look forward to hearing more from you With best wishes Don Kouri

For possible topics to be discussed at a small roundtable format meeting here are some possibilities HDAFs for data analysis including gapfilling data extrapolation denoising mathematical manipulations of digital data eg taking derivatives applying functions of differential operators to digital data etc HDAFs as the basis of numerical algorithms for solving nonlinear partial differential equations particularly for equations for which existing methods encounter stability problems There are certainly other areas of interest and applications of the HDAFs but I think that even trying to do both of the above in a single meeting would be difficult Of course in this first meeting we would focus on general aspects of the HDAFs that make them robust for such applications If however you have other topics in which you are interested I am willing to focus on them Regarding timing of a meeting I am free from teaching duties now so I am flexible I will be in Houston all of December I look forward to hearing more from you With best wishes Don Kouri

Contacts at UH for Econophysics Cc are the contacts from UH I would recommend that for a first contact the following people be involved Larry Pinsky PhysicsChair Joe McCauley professor George Reiter professor Their coordinates and some schedules are below If Larry is out of town prof Gunaratne would be a good alternative Please let me know how I can help further Yannis Forwarded by Yannis TzamouranisHOUECT on PM Prof Lawrence Pinsky on AM To cc Subject Contacts at UH for Econophysics Yannis Let me give you the names and contact information regarding the appropriate personnel here to include in an initial discussion regarding the prospects for developing a program here in we have to find a better name econophysics For an initial meeting it is reasonable to include Professores McCauley and Reiter as well as myself if I am available If I am not available you should consider including Professor Gemunu Gunaratne our current Associate Chair and a theoreticial with an interest in this area in his own right Professor Joseph McCauley Phone Fax Email Professor George Reiter Phone Fax Email Professor Chair Lawrence Pinsky Phone Fax Email OR an alternate for me Associate Professor and Associate Chair Gemunu Gunaratne Phone Fax Email Also FYI one other new faculty member with a potential interest in this field is Assistant Professor effective Kevin Bassler Phone Fax Email General Administrative Contact Ms Jennifer ChinDavis Department Business Administrator Phone Fax Email FYI I will be in Houston May June If the meeting is held on another date please include Prof Gunaratne in my place Larry

Joe McCauleys papersas promised these are a couple of references that I have for Joe McCauleys papers econophysicscommentsnoviseconometricshtml econophysicscommentsnovpaperofthemonthdechtml Whether the specific papers are of interest to what exactly were doing or not I cannot say On the other hand given UHs drive to create an Econophysics specialization within the physics department I thought we could both help them and drive it towards a direction that it could be of use to us I think that they would very much like to hear what the Industry would like to see from such a specialization Some of the things that have been discussed as course offerings would be Basic physics courses mechanics nonlinear dynamics stat physicsmath methods various finance courses like options banking etc Statistics Math Methods and Statistical Physics that could teach topics like BRownian motion lognormal distributions fractals Levy flights and statistics of large deviations which are of interest Comp Science Java C data structures algorithms Monte Carlo simulations etc Setting up some sort of exchange where at minimum we could get summer interns from this program would also be beneficial to both sides Even better a wider collaboration between Enron and the Physics department could be set up After this message I will inform Joe McCauley and Larry Pinsky departmental chair person of your suggestions on how to proceed I will send Shirley their contact information to arrange for a visit at the beginning of June Thanks Yannis

Re Spring workshop Cc It is my pleasure to announce the visit of professor Rene Carmona from Princeton on February This web site may provide a little information on professor Carmona rcarmona Professor Carmona is going to talk to us about his research endeavors in weather and financial engineering Similarly we will make a short presentation of our activities and research interests The aim of the meeting is to explore areas of common interest and investigate the possibility of collaborating in certain research areas The time is pm Room EBC is reserved for pm Please plan on attending Also do let me know if you would like to include someone else to this distribution list Yannis Tzamouranis
